document.docAuthor: Uribe, Soraya, Brown, Brian V., Bragança, Marcos A. L., Queiroz, Jarbas M. & Nogueira, Carlos A.
document.masterDocTitle: New species of Eibesfeldtphora Disney (Diptera: Phoridae) and a new key to the genus

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New species of Eibesfeldtphora Disney (Diptera: Phoridae) and a new key to the genus

paragraph.keyLead: 1 . Foretibia without dorsal longitudinal row of enlarged setulae (palisade)........................................... 2
- Foretibia with dorsal longitudinal row of enlarged setulae (palisade)............................................. 3

2 . Oviscape with single lateral, broad, posteriorly concave lobe (
Fig. 3
)............................
E. mexicanae (Disney)

- Oviscape without defined lobes (
Fig. 2
).......................................................
E. inornata
sp. n.

- Oviscape with two lateral lobes, one dorsal and ventral (although some specimens of
E. arcuata
appear to have a single, nar- rowly terminating lobe)................................................................................. 5

4 . Lobes laterally aligned, separated; ventral lobe broader, short (
Fig. 4
).............................
E. trilobata Disney

- Lobes not aligned; dorsal lobes joined, making forklike acute angle; ventral lobe separated from dorsals, narrower, longer (
Fig. 1
)....................................................................................
E. trifurcata
sp. n.

5 . In lateral view, dorsal and ventral lobes of oviscape ventrally directed, similar in size (
Fig. 5
)...........
E. digitata Brown

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 7–14. Female phorid fly oviscapes, lateral. 7.
E. leei ;
8.
E. curvinervis
; 9.
E. bragancai ;
10.
E. cumsaltensis (Disney et al. 2009)
; 11.
E. prolixa ;
12.
E. dissita ;
13.
E. breviloba (Brown et al. 2012)
; 14. E. erthali .

FIGURES 19–21. Female phorid fly oviscapes, lateral. 19.
E. attae ;
20.
E. tonhascai
; 21. E. inferna .

paragraph.keyLead: - In lateral view, at least one of the lobes of oviscape posteriorly directed; size various................................ 6

6 . Lobes extremely close together, sometimes appearing as a single structure (
Fig. 6
)...................
E . arcuata (Brown)

- Ventral lobe little defined (
Fig. 10
)......................................................
E. cumsaltensis Disney

12 . Lobes fin-shaped, ventral lobe curved ventrally (
Fig. 11
)........................................
E. prolixa (Brown)
- Lobes rounded posteriorly, ventral lobe projected posteriorly.................................................. 13
14 . In posterolateral view, ventral lobe dorsoventrally flattened................................................... 15

16 . Dorsal lobe longer than ventral (
Fig. 15
)...................................................
E. declinata (Brown)

- Dorsal and ventral lobes subequal in size (
Fig. 16
)...............................................
E. pala (Brown)

17 . Dorsal and ventral lobes separated by convex sclerotized margin (
Fig. 17
).........................
E. elongata (Brown)

18 . Lobes of similar shape and size (
Fig. 18
)..................................................
E. isomorpha (Brown)
